sect1.title: Reporting bugs
sect1.para:
Please, submit bug reports and feature requests using our
Bug and feature request database.

When reporting a bug, please specify the &mnogo; version you are using and provide as much information about your problem as possible. Information about your platform and OS, database version, database statistics (indexer -S output) will be very helpful to find and fix possible bugs.

sect2.title: Currently known bugs
sect2.para: The currently known bugs can bugs can be found in the Bug and feature request database.

sect2.title: Core dump reports
sect2.para: If &indexer; or &search.cgi; crashed and produced a core dump, it will be very helpful to send us a backtrace which can be created using gdb (The GNU Debugger). Please follow through the following steps to create a backtrace.
Run GNU Debugger with the executable as the first argument and with core file as the second:

Some information about crash will be displayed:
Core was generated by `indexer'. Program terminated with signal 8, Floating point exception. Reading symbols from /usr/lib/libc.so.3...done. Reading symbols from /usr/libexec/ld-elf.so.1...done. #0 0x80483f3 in main () at indexer.c:4 4 printf("%d",0/0);

Then type backtrace and press Enter.
(gdb) backtrace #0 0x80483f3 in main () at indexer.c:4 #1 0x804837d in _start ()
Copy the backtrace output and paste it into bug report.
